title: Sparrows 1-4
profile: Jiaqi Lyu is a painter exploring historical memory and ghost narratives through oil painting. Her work examines the spectral presence of the past in contemporary Northeast China.
description: Sparrows 1-4 is a series of oil paintings that explore the intersection of historical memory and personal narrative in Northeast China. The sparrows serve as both literal subjects and metaphorical carriers of collective memory, referencing the historical 'Four Pests Campaign' while reflecting on themes of survival, resilience, and the haunting presence of the past.

title: Fuwu Zhi / 伏物志
profile: Sihong Liu is an artist working with material culture and sensory memory, focusing on the everyday objects and textures of Northeast Chinese life.
description: Fuwu Zhi (Hidden Objects Record) explores the material culture and concealed memories in Northeast China through found objects and mixed media. The work features dried fruit brooches and other everyday artifacts that carry hidden stories and cultural meanings, examining how ordinary objects become vessels of memory and identity.

title: Land
profile: Zhenghang Fu is an artist whose work investigates the relationship between land, history, and memory in Northeast China.
description: Land is a series exploring the Northeast Chinese landscape as a repository of historical memory. The work traces the layers of history embedded in the land—from agricultural collectivization to industrial decline—examining how geography holds and transmits collective trauma and resilience.

title: 瑞雪兆丰年 / Auspicious Snow Heralds a Good Year
profile: Zengbo Qi is an artist exploring sensory memory and traditional agricultural wisdom in Northeast China.
description: 瑞雪兆丰年 (Auspicious Snow Heralds a Good Year) is a work that explores the relationship between weather, agriculture, and collective hope in Northeast China. The traditional saying encapsulates the optimism of peasant life, where heavy winter snow promises moisture for spring planting. The work examines how such folk wisdom carries sensory memories—the cold, the whiteness, the anticipation—that connect generations.

title: The Shenyang's Tale / 沈阳故事
profile: Shunshun Qi is an artist working with family archives and personal narratives in the context of urban transformation in Shenyang.
description: The Shenyang's Tale is a deeply personal exploration of family memory set against the backdrop of Shenyang's urban transformation. Through photographs, documents, and personal artifacts, the work traces the artist's family history through the city's industrial rise and decline, examining how personal and collective histories intertwine.

title: When the Blossoms Fade / 花落时节
profile: Bomin Kim is a Korean artist exploring cross-border identity and the shared cultural heritage of Northeast Asia.
description: When the Blossoms Fade explores themes of transience, memory, and cultural exchange across Northeast Asian borders. Drawing on Korean, Chinese, and Japanese aesthetic traditions, the work meditates on the fleeting nature of beauty and the persistence of cultural memory across national boundaries.

title: Noise / 噪音
profile: Ziyan Liu is an artist working with sound, displacement, and identity in the context of migration and border crossing.
description: Noise is an audio-visual exploration of displacement and identity. The work captures the cacophony of modern life—urban sounds, voices, static—as metaphors for the fragmented experience of migration and cultural displacement. Through layered soundscapes, it examines how identity is constructed and deconstructed through sensory experience.

title: Northeast Asia Memory / 东北亚记忆
profile: Evey Sun is an artist exploring collective memory and sensory experience in Northeast Asia.
description: Northeast Asia Memory is a multisensory exploration of shared memories across the Northeast Asian region. The work brings together visual, auditory, and tactile elements to evoke the common threads of experience—cold winters, industrial landscapes, migratory patterns—that connect peoples across national boundaries.

profile: Xiaoze Zhang is an artist working with personal and family archives, exploring memory at the turn of the millennium.
description: 1999 is a deeply personal work that explores the artist's family history and childhood memories at the turn of the millennium. Through archival materials and personal artifacts, the work examines how individual memory intersects with collective historical moments, particularly the anxieties and hopes surrounding Y2K.

title: Untitled (Yusuke Kuriki)
profile: Yusuke Kuriki is a Japanese artist exploring material culture and sensory memory across Northeast Asia.
description: This work by Yusuke Kuriki explores the material textures and sensory experiences that connect Japanese and Northeast Chinese cultures. Through careful attention to objects, surfaces, and spaces, the work reveals the subtle ways in which memory is embedded in the physical world.

title: Untitled (Kyra Zhang)
profile: Kyra Zhang is an artist exploring identity, displacement, and border crossing in contemporary Northeast Asia.
description: Kyra Zhang's work examines the complexities of identity formation in the context of transnational movement and cultural hybridity. The work traces personal and collective experiences of displacement, exploring how identity is negotiated across cultural and national boundaries.

title: Untitled (Yizheng Liu)
profile: Yizheng Liu is an artist working with themes of displacement, identity, and cross-cultural experience.
description: Yizheng Liu's work explores the experience of cultural displacement and the formation of hybrid identities. Through personal narrative and broader historical research, the work examines how individuals negotiate belonging across different cultural contexts.

title: Untitled (Rikuto Fujimoto)
profile: Rikuto Fujimoto is a Japanese artist exploring material culture and sensory memory in the Northeast Asian context.
description: Rikuto Fujimoto's work investigates the material and sensory dimensions of cultural memory. Through attention to textures, temperatures, and tactile experiences, the work reveals how memory is stored and transmitted through physical engagement with the world.

title: Untitled (Fanglin Luo)
profile: Fanglin Luo is an artist working with sensory memory and material culture.
description: Fanglin Luo's work explores the sensory dimensions of memory and experience. Through attention to smell, taste, touch, and sound, the work examines how non-visual senses carry and transmit cultural memory.

title: Untitled (Yiwen Liang)
profile: Yiwen Liang is an artist exploring material and sensory memory in contemporary contexts.
description: Yiwen Liang's work investigates how everyday materials and sensory experiences carry cultural memory. The work pays particular attention to the textures, sounds, and rhythms of daily life that connect individuals to larger collective experiences.

title: Untitled (Jungyun Lee)
profile: Jungyun Lee is a Korean artist working with historical memory and ghost narratives in the Northeast Asian context.
description: Jungyun Lee's work explores the ghostly presence of history in contemporary Northeast Asia. Drawing on Korean shamanic traditions and concepts of spectral presence, the work examines how unresolved historical traumas continue to haunt the present.

title: Untitled (Shuyi Alice Wang)
profile: Shuyi Alice Wang is an artist working with family archives and personal narratives.
description: Shuyi Alice Wang's work explores family history and personal memory through archival materials and oral history. The work traces the artist's family across generations, examining how personal narratives intersect with larger historical forces.

title: 东北书 / A Book of Northeast China
major: Art History & Linguistics, East Asian Contemporary Art
profile: Jade Xiaojing Gu is a PhD candidate at the Central Academy of Fine Arts, researching art history and linguistics with a focus on East Asian contemporary art. Her creative practice spans photography, video, and collage, exploring the tension between private and public memory.
description:
《东北书》使用传统的中国书籍装帧方式，通过摄影与文字，结合艺术家个人经历，围绕东北人成长中的记忆与失忆、思乡与漂泊，制作成一本手工书。呈现东北在21世纪以来的变与不变，表达东北人对家乡既喜爱又无奈的复杂情感。

作品以五感为结构：
- 记忆 Memory：水塔、南湖公园、童年照片
- 听觉 Auditory：《月儿明风儿静》摇篮曲
- 嗅觉 Smell：丹东草莓、冻货（冻梨、冻柿子）
- 味觉 Taste：锅包肉、麻辣烫、早餐摊
- 触觉 Tactile：冰雪触感、冰城堡
- 视觉 Vision：冰雪经济、冬季娱乐

关键意象：
- "东北人的成年礼是一张南下的车票"
- "如果一个东北人说想吃锅包肉，那他是在说他想家了"
- "东北不仅是地理位置，也是一种舒服、幸福、悠闲、质朴的心理状态"
material: Paper, Photography, Text (Traditional Chinese book binding)
